PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES: define crop propagation

CONTENT: Meaning of Propagation
Propagation: by seed (sexual), by vegetative organs

Advantages of Propagation by: Seed (easy to carry, store, procure, sow), Vegetative organs: more resistant to diseases and pests, matures and produces early, Withstand adverse soil and weather conditions
Disadvantages of Propagation by: Seed: Reduce the amount for consumption, Seed does not germinate easily due to dormancy; Vegetative organs: Diseases of stock is manifested in offspring easily stored
Cultural Practices: Thinning, Supplying, Mulching etc
TEACHER ACTIVITIES: Displays charts and pictures on crop propagation
Collects and displays samples of seeds and vegetative organs of named crop plants
